item.title: Jagex Suing Impsoft
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:116, topic:328998”][quote author=chri5 link=topic=425385.msg3183547#msg3183547 date=1271531253]

you can do it to private ltds? link plz i didnt know that
[/quote]yeah I thought this too, only shareholders and potential shareholders (who have received an invitation) could view the financials of an ltd. However with a plc, it’s all public.

but jagex aren’t a plc, or any other type of public company

so what shareholders

Private limited companies have shareholders…

they have to have some form of relation to the business owner iirc[/quote]
Chosen by the current shareholders in a mutual agreement. Anyone can get the documents, they’re £1 each.

For example: A provider could check the financial documents of a LTD (Anyone can make an LTD, £20 if you fill in the papers yourself) to check if they’d be reliable on a net 30 payment agreement.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex Suing Impsoft
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

i’m not sure what tedder does anymore since he was replaced as CEO, i assumed they kicked him out cuz he sucked, but you might be right

EDIT: ok we were all wrong:

when jagex first registered with companies house rather than being a sole trader, the gowers held 30% each and tedder 40%, at some point this siwtched up so that constant had 20%, paul had 20%, andrew 59% and ian gower (another brother?) 1%.

in 2005 they got VC from www.insightpartners.com, they bought 35%, leaving 13% for tedder (lol, slowly realising how inept he was?) 13% for paul, 38.35% for andrew and 0.65% for the mysterious ian.

edit2: apparently ian gower helped on the original deviousmud with graphics

i cant seem to find out if things changed when the paypal guy (forget his name atm) replaced tedder as ceo. tedder remains on the board of directors and two people from insight partners also joined as directors at some point.

im not bored honest

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex Suing Impsoft
item.dc:creator: @repacsenur repacsenur
item.description:
@repacsenur wrote:

Lothy:

I thought they were getting sued – how come their website is still up and running?

because keeping the website up = more profit then being scared and waiting to get summoned to court why not profit because either way you will get sued thats how they think.

Also I’ve seen RSBot’s website some chinese guy took over wouldn’t that mean if he got sued the ad providers payout home address (check?)/paypal would be linked to some that chinese guy or still back to quaters home? (obviously chinese guy is made up) or he thinks oh when I get sued I’ll shutdown my ad provider accounts and all traces of me will be gone! Lol that would be funny when they get RSBot.

I’ve been sued for unpaid shit before it’s not pretty they don’t even let you talk they only listen to the lawyers.

Read full topic
